result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J Kronenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
May serve last half of the sentence on electronic monitor if comply.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Concurrent with: with any other sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs/DNA surcharges.  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Maintain full time employment to the extent that Defendant is able.
No contact with Fleet Farm store in Stevens Point
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations. Agent can accept the assessment Defendant previously completed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sarah J Kronenberg in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:26 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1.

Atty Renc concurs, her client is on probation for another matter.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Felony Retail Theft as a repeater

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 9 Months, Imposed and Stayed
Consecutive to any other sentence
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve last half of the sentence on electronic monitor if comply
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Concurrent to any other sentence Defendant is serving
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Perform 25 hours of Community Service
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations. Agent can accept the assessment Defendant previously completed.
Maintain full time employment to the extent that Defendant is able
No contact with Fleet Farm store in Stevens Point
Plea hearing at 05-29-2015 08:30 am
Plea hearing at 05-29-2015 08:30 am

10:00 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Defendant has not arrived in Court as of 10:01 a.m.
Arraignment not completed today; to be scheduled with plea hearing.
Atty Cousins states that this case has already been pre-tried.

BY THE COURT:
Bond Continued.  
Plea hearing/Arraignment scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
